revised_title: Effects of Endurance Exercise on Dystrophic mdx Mice: Contractile Properties of Skinned Muscle Fibres
tldr: The study investigates the effects of a 15-week endurance exercise program on dystrophic mdx mice, focusing on the contractile properties of single skinned muscle fibers from the extensor digitorum longus and soleus muscles. The results show that endurance exercise can modify the Ca2+- and Sr2+-activated contractile characteristics of muscle fibers, suggesting that exercise may have potential therapeutic benefits for dystrophic muscle conditions.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Muscle Physiology
